definitions.usage: 指用手或工具迅速、有力地抓住某物，通常带有突然或果断的动作，常用于描述物理动作。

examples.scene: 在一个热闹的招聘会上，张伟看到一家心仪的公司正在收简历，但人潮拥挤，他必须快速行动才能递上自己的简历。
examples.chineseIdea: 张伟意识到这是一个展示自己能力的好时机，必须果断行动，不能犹豫。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: He decided to @ @ @ and hand in his resume before the crowd grew larger.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: He decided to 「seize an opportunity」 and hand in his resume before the crowd grew larger.
examples.chineseTranslation: 他决定「抓住机会」，在人群更大之前递上简历。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：He catched a chance to give his resume. 纠正：He seized an opportunity to hand in his resume.

examples.scene: 在一场激烈的辩论赛中，李娜发现对手出现了一个逻辑漏洞，她立刻插话反驳，扭转了局面。
examples.chineseIdea: 李娜知道这是一个关键时刻，必须迅速利用对手的失误来赢得优势。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: She quickly @ @ @ to point out the flaw in her opponent’s argument.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: She quickly 「seized the moment」 to point out the flaw in her opponent’s argument.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她迅速「抓住时机」，指出对手论点的漏洞。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：She took the time to show the mistake. 纠正：She seized the moment to point out the flaw.

definitions.usage: 指通过武力、权力或其他手段强行占有某物或某地，常用于军事、政治或权力斗争的语境。

examples.scene: 在一场公司内部的权力斗争中，新上任的经理通过一系列大胆的决策，成功获得了部门的领导权。
examples.chineseIdea: 新经理知道只有果断行动，才能在混乱中确立自己的权威。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The new manager moved swiftly to @ @ @ of the department.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The new manager moved swiftly to 「seize control」 of the department.
examples.chineseTranslation: 新经理迅速行动，「控制」了部门。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The manager got the department’s power. 纠正：The manager seized control of the department.

examples.scene: 在一款策略游戏中，玩家需要快速占领敌方的资源点以获得优势，小明果断出击，拿下了一个关键据点。
examples.chineseIdea: 小明明白占领这个资源点是赢得游戏的关键，必须毫不犹豫地行动。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Ming acted decisively to @ @ @ in the game.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Ming acted decisively to 「seize territory」 in the game.
examples.chineseTranslation: 小明果断行动，在游戏中「占领领土」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：Ming took the place in the game. 纠正：Ming seized territory in the game.

definitions.usage: 指法律或权威机构因违规、犯罪等原因强行取走某物，常用于正式或法律语境。

examples.scene: 在一次海关检查中，工作人员发现一名旅客携带了违禁品，立即没收了这些物品。
examples.chineseIdea: 海关人员需要依法处理违禁品，维护安全和秩序。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The customs officer acted quickly to @ @ @ from the traveler.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The customs officer acted quickly to 「seize goods」 from the traveler.
examples.chineseTranslation: 海关人员迅速行动，从旅客那里「没收货物」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The officer took away the things. 纠正：The officer seized goods from the traveler.

examples.scene: 一家公司因涉嫌税务欺诈，银行账户被政府冻结，相关财产也被查封。
examples.chineseIdea: 政府需要通过查封财产来确保法律的执行和公平。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The government moved to @ @ @ of the company as part of the investigation.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The government moved to 「seize assets」 of the company as part of the investigation.
examples.chineseTranslation: 政府采取行动，作为调查的一部分「没收公司资产」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：The government took the company’s money. 纠正：The government seized assets of the company.
